properties.Comment:
Peak Level - Summer 2002
The gardens and out buildings of 3 properties in Gargrave flooded from an ordinary
watercourse. The gardens of properties on River Place flooded from the River Aire,
however watercourse. The gardens of properties on River Place flooded from the
River Aire.
properties.Email: Submit flood report

properties.Comment:
Peak Level - Autumn 2000
In total 35 residential properties, 4 commercial properties, 1 factory (Johnson and
Johnson), the village church and 12 caravans at the site in New Brighton were
affected by flooding. The Johnson & Johnson factory was flooded to a depth of 0.2m
with the flooding being attributed to both the River Aire and Eshton Beck. Properties
on River Place and Water Street are believed to have flooded from surface water
which had no drainage route since the volume of water in the River Aire had backed
up drains. The depth of flooding in some properties reached 0.5m
